title: Ode to Joy
description: Play Beethoven's famous melody from the 9th Symphony.

steps.title: Ode to Joy by Beethoven
steps.description: This iconic melody is one of the most recognizable tunes in classical music. It uses only 5 notes (E, F, G, A, B) in the key of C major, making it perfect for beginners. We'll learn it in four phrases.

steps.title: Phrase 1: E E F G
steps.description: Play: E E F G. This is the opening motif.
steps.hint: Start on E4 (MIDI 64). The first three notes step up.

steps.title: Phrase 2: G F E D
steps.description: Play: G F E D. The melody comes back down.
steps.hint: Walk down from G to D, one step at a time.

steps.title: Phrase 3: E E F G
steps.description: The same opening motif repeats! Play: E E F G.

steps.title: Phrase 4: F E D E
steps.description: The ending is slightly different. Play: F E D then back up to E.
steps.hint: Walk down F to D, then come back to E.

steps.title: Bridge: D D E
steps.description: The bridge section starts with: D D E. These are lower, building tension.
steps.hint: Start on D and move up to E.

steps.title: Harmony: C Major
steps.description: The opening uses a C major chord as harmony.

steps.title: Harmony: G Major
steps.description: The melody resolves to G major.

steps.title: Full Melody Checkpoint
steps.description: Play phrases 1-4 and the bridge in sequence with steady timing.
steps.hint: Keep the repeated opening motif consistent both times.

steps.title: Review Quiz
steps.description: Which note set best describes the core melody notes used in this lesson?

steps.title: Congratulations!
steps.description: You've learned Ode to Joy! This melody is a great warm-up exercise â€” try playing it at different speeds and in different octaves.
